channel.title: math.HO updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.HO updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Iterating sine, equivalence classes of variable changes, and groups with few conjugacy classes
item.description: arXiv:2506.16364v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This is an expository paper about iterations of a smooth real function $f$ on $[0,\varepsilon)$ such that $f(0)=0$, $f'(0)=1$, and $f(x)<x$ for $x>0$, i.e., the sequence defined by $x_{n+1}=f(x_n)$. This sequence has interesting asymptotics, whose study leads to the question of classifying conjugacy classes in the group of formal changes of variable $y=f(x)$, i.e., formal series $f(x)=x+a_2x^2+a_3x^2+...$ with real coefficients (under composition). The same classification applies over a finite field $\mathbb{F}_p$ for suitably truncated series $f$, defining a family of $p$-groups which have the smallest number of conjugacy classes for a given order, i.e., are the ``most noncommutative" finite groups currently known. The paper should be accessible to undergraduates and at least partially to advanced high school students.
item.dc:creator: Pavel Etingof

item.title: Weyl's Quantifiers
item.description: arXiv:2408.08562v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Weyl's quantifiers generate conditional obligations. Thus, I argue, his interpretation of the quantified statements of transfinite mathematics should not be conflated with Hilbert's.
item.dc:creator: Iulian D. Toader

item.title: Unified constructions of the regular Heptagon and Triskaidecagon
item.description: arXiv:2505.05673v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Constructions of regular heptagon and triskaidecagon by trisection of an angle are well known. An elegant construction of the heptagon by S. Adlaj shows a 3-fold symmetry related to a Galois group. Based on the latter construction, in this article one more for the heptagon and two more for the triskaidecagon are presented, all using angle trisection.
item.dc:creator: Helmut Ruhland

item.title: An old number theory problem related to the Legendre symbol
item.description: arXiv:2506.02434v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: The main purpose of this paper is using a very simple constructive method to study an old number theory problem related to the Legendre symbol modulo $p$, and completely solved it. The proving method of the result is purely elementary and has been desired in the literature at least since 1927.
item.dc:creator: Wenpeng Zhang
